props.title: Welcome to Coding Fundamentals
props.prompt: In this module, you will test your knowledge of basic coding concepts through multiple-choice questions. These questions cover essential programming topics including variables, data types, control flow, and functions. Select the correct answer for each question and receive immediate feedback.

props.title: Module Overview
props.message: You are about to begin a series of coding concept questions designed to reinforce your programming knowledge.
props.explanation: This module uses multiple-choice questions to help you identify and correct misconceptions about coding fundamentals.

props.question: How confident are you in your coding fundamentals knowledge before starting?

metadata.title: Multiple Choice
metadata.description: Single or multiple answer selection with feedback

props.title: Question 1: Variable Declaration
props.question: Which of the following correctly declares a variable in JavaScript?
props.explanation: In JavaScript, variables are declared using 'var', 'let', or 'const' keywords. Option A uses 'var', which is the traditional way to declare variables. Option B assigns without declaration, C and D use invalid syntax.

metadata.title: Feedback Box
metadata.description: Shows correctness, explanation, and next steps

props.title: Question 1 Complete
props.message: You've answered the first question about variable declaration.
props.explanation: Variable declaration is a fundamental concept. Understanding the difference between var, let, and const is essential for writing modern JavaScript code.

props.question: How confident are you in your understanding of variable declaration?

metadata.title: Multiple Choice
metadata.description: Single or multiple answer selection with feedback

props.title: Question 2: Control Flow
props.question:
What will be the output of the following code?
if (5 > 3) { console.log('true'); } else { console.log('false'); }
props.explanation: Since 5 is greater than 3, the condition evaluates to true, so the if block executes and outputs 'true'. The else block is skipped when the condition is true.

metadata.title: Feedback Box
metadata.description: Shows correctness, explanation, and next steps

props.title: Question 2 Complete
props.message: You've successfully answered the control flow question.
props.explanation: Understanding if-else statements is crucial for controlling program execution flow. This pattern allows your code to make decisions and execute different blocks based on conditions.
nextSteps: Continue with additional control flow scenarios

props.question: How confident are you in your understanding of control flow and conditionals?
